Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Jun 13 20:55:14 2017 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.

web address.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, and a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top here.
Lily Kaise is lying on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator beeps quietly, indicating that it
has unread notices.

[New Earth; Central Stellar Cartography Branch]
Official-looking lettering declares this to be a branch of Central Stellar
Cartography, a galactic mapping organization recognized by all of the alliances.
One entire wall of the room is in fact the front of a massive computer which
extends into an adjacent room. Technicians constantly feed data into the
machine. In the center of the room, a holographic representation of the galaxy
is being projected. An extraordinarily tiny dot in one of the galaxy's spiral
arms is labeled simply "KNOWN SPACE."
You can go northeast.
submit
You approach one of the technicians who, upon learning that you're a civilian
pilot, quickly checks to see if any discoveries of new extrasolar planets are
under your name.
The technician says, "Congratulations! Your ship surveyed forty-nine planets,
and they were all new discoveries! There's a credit reward, of course. I'll
arrange the transfer right now."
The CSC transfers 3,062,500,000.00 EAOS credits to your account.
0.00 credits of your income have gone toward your organization.

lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole

glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, Purr the humanoid service robot, a
wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic
life and coral rocks, and a small white trash bin here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, Purr the humanoid service robot, a
wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic
life and coral rocks, a small white trash bin, and Prissy the big violet
long-haired felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

with bright white floodlights.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, Purr the humanoid service robot, a
wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic
life and coral rocks, a small white trash bin, and Cheri-Pye the large light
violet felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Asteroid Belt Management Station]
This is an asteroid belt management station. Through large transparisteel
windows, you can see the asteroid stations themselves glittering amongst the
tumbling asteroids of the belt. The station managers need never actually visit
these stations, however, instead conducting their business via a number of
terminals.

[Starship "Stormbringer"; Weapons Room Two]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.

l katina
Katina Faye
She appears to be 23 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has caramel skin. Her body is voluptuous with attractively curved hips and
shapely calves. She has slender shoulders and a large bust. Her face is
heart-shaped and lovely, with a button nose and elegant fine chin. Her lips are
full soft and applied with strawberry-flavored lipstick, and occasionally part
to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of expressive eyebrows, her eyes
are hazel and almond-shaped, and enhanced with black eyeshadow. Her
waist-length, straight hair is shiny black and hanging in a smooth fall, the
ends slightly curled under. She has oval light pink fingernails.
 She is wearing a finely crafted diamond choker, a black silk tanktop, a
delicate chain of tiny aquamarines around her waist, a pair of skinny blue
lowrise jeans with black and sapphire blue jeweled teardrops on the front and
back pockets, and a pair of black silk stilettos. She is also wearing a mood
ring, a pair of earrings with delicate diamond rosebuds suspended from tiny
silver studs, a black silk handbag embroidered with crimson dragonflies, and a
pair of magnificent glossy dark brown eagle wings. Her head, face, both eyes,
both shoulders, both biceps, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both
hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

[Chetumal Spaceport; Landing Pad]
Carved out of the top of one of the old mountains north of Chetumal City, the
landing pad of this spaceport has an unmatched panoramic view of the
countryside. A low cliff shelters it on the north side, with mail, security, and
repair facilities built into it, and recent construction efforts have expanded
the area and given it a sleek new look. The pad itself consists of a patchwork
of heavy plasteel panels bordered by beams of lighted steel, the panels
variously sized to accommodate any model of starship, no matter how large or
small. A modern but somewhat noisy hydraulic system moves starships between the
landing pad and the garage below. On the south side of the pad is the pilot
lounge with large, tinted windows overlooking the fine Chetumalian landscape to
the south. You can GO into its sleek glass-framed doorway. There is also a
doorway here marked 'Liaison Office,' which you can also GO into. A doorway to
the south leads to the Salvage Reclamation Project Center, and a wide metal
stairway leads down into lower levels of the spaceport.
The four-person light carrier "Lunch Box" and the five-person mass production
scythe "Stormbringer" are landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a long row of cinder blocks, a trash can,
and Vim the mound of parking tickets here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and down.

l
[Starship "Shooting Star"; Control Capsule]
This small capsule is only large enough for one person. A single flight seat
molds itself to the form of its occupant, helping to ease the burden of
acceleration along with a rather underpowered artificial gravity dampening
system. The capsule's inner workings extend into the flight cabin, with the
starship's main computer right up against the back of the seat. A rather sparse
flight control board is presented claustrophobically close to the pilot's face.
It seems to lack any sort of manual control, allowing only automatic flight
profiles to be entered into an antiquated flight computer. It does, however,
possess controls to operate a single small turret. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad. The hatch appears to be locked.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go out.
(You are sitting.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a personal hoverpallet, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, Purr
the humanoid service robot, and Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, and Purr the humanoid service
robot here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
Once the frontier of Known Space for many years, the Borderlands region is now a
settled area of space, though rather poor compared to most others. A handful of
beacons indicate the positions of clouds of debris, but a nearby star indicates
a solar system may also be in this cluster.

"Detecting vessel 'Firestorm.' Welcome to Beacon D-07."

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on yellow alert. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, a pair of skinny
blue low rise jeans, a lavender lace demi bra, a pair of lavender leather boots,
a lavender hoodie with a gold 'XX' embroidered on the front, a pair of soft
lavender silk bikini panties, a pair of white socks, a soft Bahama blue cotton
polo, a pair of slim black linen trousers, a pair of white cotton briefs, and
Prissy the big violet long-haired felo here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.

and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of

You are concealing a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a
metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a leather briefcase, a flight
control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a scorched
metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a thick synthleather bandolier
with large pockets, a camera bag, and a black engineering tool case. Your head,
face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
There appear to be some people in the lounge.

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a sleeveless lilac cotton top with scalloped edges, a pair of
blue stonewashed denim jeans with a small dark red 'XX' embroidered on the left
front pocket, and a pair of white leather clogs with a row of glittery fireflies
across the toes. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her
wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved
with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst
crystals, a light purple flightbag with a pastel kitten on the side, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, an
elegant white gold ring inset with a perfect solitaire diamond, and a soft
fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes,
neck, both biceps, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and both hands are
left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, Purr the humanoid service
robot, and Cheri-Pye the large light violet felo here.

salvage stations, your choice."

Once a waystation between Old Earth and its newly settled colony, the Colonial
Gate station is now largely irrelevant, but still stands guard here as a sort of
watchtower.
The Centauri Colony remains Old Earth's only remaining major extrasolar
possession. The planet does not appear to be particularly teeming with life,
with the color of the land fading from brownish grasses to grey bedrock.

knowledge combat
Your knowledge of starship combat experience for all alliances:
   Lily Kaise has the most starship combat points among the AEU.
      She is also known among the AEU for being the best at advanced engineering
techniques, the best with mission-related ship kills, very good at combat
gunning, and the owner of an ASS-E7 Allied Starships Modular Tactical Platform.
   
   Shule Elemmire has a good amount of starship combat points among the AEU.
      He is also known among the AEU for being the best at combat gunning and
the owner of an AH-12b AEU Soothsayer-class Cruiser Mark II.
   
   Bryan Stout has a high amount of starship combat points among the League.
      He is also known among the League for being the best at combat gunning,
excellent with mission-related ship kills, and the owner of a LHS-G23b League
Prime Defense Cruiser Mark II.
   
   Melinda Michaels has the most starship combat points among the League.
      She is also known among the League for being the best at advanced
engineering techniques, the best with minor skirmish ship kills, the best with
mission-related ship kills, very good at combat piloting, and the owner of a
T6-09 Telex Defense Inc. Pincer-Class Forward Assault Frigate.
   
   Cesar Ysidro has the most starship combat points among the Fringe.
      He is also known among the Fringe for being the best at combat piloting,
the best at combat gunning, excellent with mission-related ship kills, and very
good with invading ship kills.
   
   Ather Jammoa has a high amount of starship combat points among the AEU.
      He is also known among the AEU for being the best at combat piloting, the
best at damage control, the best with invading ship kills, and the owner of an
AH-12 AEU Soothsayer-class Cruiser.

[Accord of Free Worlds; Service Ring; Civilian Starship Requisitions]
The corridor curves smoothly between the station's starboard and aft horizontal
supports. The bulkheads and deck are made of a darkened, glossy metal, though
not as dark as the station's exterior. Emergency lights are mounted every three
meters overhead. Light blue trim where the bulkheads meet the deck indicate that
this is the Service Deck. An open, curving space has been carved out of the
interior bulkheads and contains a starship purchasing terminal. Several rotating
holographic displays show AFW starship models.

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
The two-person light transport "Jack Of All Trades" and the five-person strike
gunboat "Morning Dove" are landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair with Xavier the old sleeping
big silver soldier felo on it, a large oval white and black cloth rug, a rare
black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and sapphire star quilt on
it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow
and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white trash bin, Magellan the
arachnoid security robot, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair with Xavier the old sleeping
big silver soldier felo on it, a large oval white and black cloth rug, a rare
black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and sapphire star quilt on
it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a glossy silver ceramic
felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow
and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white trash bin, Magellan the
arachnoid security robot, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.

rd
Uncharted Sector (Unclaimed) [The Radio Bubble] (Security: Delta-10)
Coordinate rundown:
Starships: William Dove (M) at (8, 9, 18)
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, Purr the humanoid service
robot, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container, and
a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
Lily Kaise says to you, "Go for any you want."
Lily Kaise grins.
Lily Kaise presses a button, calling up the coordinate rundown, and studies it
for a moment.
'ok, sorry. I'm a bit distracted.
You say, "Ok, sorry. I'm a bit distracted."
Lily Kaise says, "No problem."

chartreuse glowing interior drifts slowly across the tank.

The vacuum of space seems oddly peaceful now that it surrounds you. It is not
deep black as you expected, but seems to be filled with a diffuse glow. Stars
glint all around you, stunningly bright and sharp with no atmosphere or
vacuum-protected glass to distort their light. A wide smear of stars fills one
area of the sky, pointing the way Coreward.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Purr the humanoid service robot, a compact white refrigerator, a
clear plastic food storage container, and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.

and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, an
early warning space defense device, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo chow bowl,
and KitCat the humanoid service robot here.

the hatch, and carefully float inside, orienting yourself so that your feet hit
the floor as you enter the ship's artificial gravity field.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Purr the humanoid service robot, a compact white refrigerator, a
clear plastic food storage container, and a Tardick lizard named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Purr the humanoid service robot, a compact white refrigerator, and a
clear plastic food storage container here.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Purr the humanoid service robot, a compact white refrigerator, and a
clear plastic food storage container here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
[AEU | 1: Alliance Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "Regardless, let's not
make assumptions!"

The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Beta 287."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.
You hear a steady, rhythmic sound. The mist clears, and you gaze out through the
window at the passing landscape as the train chugs along.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to League Passively Beaconed Autonavigating Recharging Battery-Powered
Transmitter in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation order is
entered."

claws together.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, a pair of white
socks, a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of slim black linen trousers, and
a pair of white cotton briefs here.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of
lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a hand-made purple and
amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow on it.)

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Purr the humanoid service robot, a compact white refrigerator, and a
clear plastic food storage container here.
You can go south and out.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
ftl mir
The darkened, airless hulk of the Mir space station looms in the distance. Its
existence as a busy neutral port ended abruptly when an Outsider phased
destabilizing beam pierced the center of the station. Clouds of sparkling debris
still mark the weapon's entry and exit points.
Via general sector communication, Mir transmits in a robotic voice, "Detecting
vessel 'William Dove.' Welcome to Mir."

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

plastic frond of light green sea fern.

The starship has entered a unique area of space.
Though close to inhabited space, this starship graveyard is too far from a
planetary body or major gravitational field to eventually spread apart. The
wrecks and debris here will remain floating as they are right now for perhaps an
eternity unless someone like yourself interferes.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel destination reached."

l
[Starship "Herding Cats"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered Transmitter;
Docking Bay.
You see a rare black EAOSian contoured couch, an early warning space defense
device, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly containing a Tardick lizard
named Asteria here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and

aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, Purr the humanoid service robot, a compact white refrigerator, and a
clear plastic food storage container here.

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The starship has left a unique area of space.

away. When it passes, the ship is a drifting platform hovering through a barren
hellscape covered in ash. A volcano spews ash and fire into the blackened sky as
glowing lava flows down its sides. The scorched remains of trees, animals, and
humans caught in the blast litter the ground.

Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

[Starship "William Dove"; Observation Deck]
This room leads to the living quarters, and contains some additional amenities,
notably a tiny alcove containing a shower. A small keypad controls access to the
living quarters. A standalone starmap viewer appears to be installed here. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered
Transmitter; Docking Bay.
You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak
table from Old Earth, a textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting
a white-colored glow), a violet leather sectional sofa, a glossy lilac ceramic
felo chow bowl, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a wall-sized bubbling coral
pink-lit aquarium containing red and light green aquatic life and coral rocks, a
personal hoverpallet, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, Xavier the old big silver
soldier felo, and a hairy yellow eight-legged ArachnoPal named Higgins here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

too. Thank you. [07:45 26 June 2317 GST]

peer out
You peer out...
[League Recharging Battery-Powered Transmitter; Docking Bay]
A small, basic docking bay is the core of the station, along with the life
support system and resource storage. Small hatches lead to the other station
modules.
The four-person space constructor "Herding Cats", the five-person A.S.S.
tactical platform "William Dove", and the two-person medium transport "The Cat's
Meow" are parked here.
You can go north, up, and down.

focus on one or the other.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at League Recharging Battery-Powered
Transmitter; Docking Bay.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
Purr the humanoid service robot, and a hairy yellow eight-legged ArachnoPal
named Higgins here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

l
[Starship "Wandering Soul"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a sapphire blue nylon-netted chair and Gadget the humanoid service robot
here.
Eli Grey is sitting on a sapphire blue nylon-netted chair.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Kalina"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a tiger stripe leather sofa, a soft rectangular white rug with a design
of black and cinnamon brown cats, and a black leather captain's chair here.
You can go south and out.
power

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
sit chair
You sit down on a black leather captain's chair.
The darkened, airless hulk of the Mir space station looms in the distance. Its
existence as a busy neutral port ended abruptly when an Outsider phased
destabilizing beam pierced the center of the station. Clouds of sparkling debris
still mark the weapon's entry and exit points.
Via general sector communication, Mir transmits in a robotic voice, "Detecting
vessel 'Kalina.' Welcome to Mir."

you wish to pay this?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

You transfer a toll payment to a local rift accelerator.
[Notification from Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] The organization has
received 998,942.48 EAOS credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating
Battery-Powered Toll Station in Mir.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Artifact Beacon Alpha 777. Local rift
accelerator with matching vector found."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
[0m[Miriani] [General Communication] Anton Navarro transmits, "Spots for bzzr's."[0m
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
A high pitched whistling sound screams overhead as a mortar shell flies through
the air. It explodes nearby with tremendous force, and when the dust and smoke
clears, the starship is gone, replaced with a deep earthen trench and the sounds
of battle.

rift stop
You press a button on the rift drive control board, and the starship begins
dropping out of the riftflow.
A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.
The computer announces, "Autotravel cancelled."
ftl 776
The computer announces, "Setting course to Home Beacon Alpha 776."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.

read stationery
--
Dear Shule,
I apologize for the lack of communication on my part. I haven't taken piloting
as seriously as I might, or communications. So today I resolved to do something
about that. *smiles* Thanks for saying I look cute. That was very sweet of you!
You seem fairly good looking and yyou have a great sense of yourself. Not afraid
to banter or be silly but serious when the situation warrents. Well, take care
of yourself. If you are still giving away felo i'm still interested. I just paid
my phone bill so i'm a phone call away. Have yourself a lovely day and safe

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
Purr the humanoid service robot, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, and a small hot
tea dispenser here.
Lily Kaise is sleeping on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
i
 You are wearing a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of slim black linen
trousers, and a pair of gray canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you are wearing a
pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of white socks. You are also wearing a
keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone
holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer. You are concealing a black flightbag with a red shooting star on
the side, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a leather briefcase, a
flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a thick synthleather
bandolier with large pockets, a camera bag, and a black engineering tool case.
Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and
both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying Mischief the large black felo in your right hand.

The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Starship "Critical Strike"; Docking Bay.

[0m[Miriani] [Newbie] Jhonas Andromidas: Can someone help me, please? I am new.[0m
[0m[Miriani] [Newbie] Moiraine Soto: What kind of assistance do you need? Have you
read any of the getting started help files?[0m
[0m[Miriani] [Newbie] Jhonas Andromidas: I'm trying to figure out which
organization I should join.[0m
[0m[Miriani] [Newbie] Lance Martellato: Read each room description, and go with
whatever you think your character will do best roleplaying in. It is possible to
switch alliances later down the road if you feel like you made the wrong choice,
but for the early stages of the game, it doesn't matter a whole lot.[0m
[0m[Miriani] [Newbie] Moiraine Soto: The best I can tell you is to explore the room
for each of your options. Short descriptions are given for each alliance that
you may choose. You can read also about the history for the alliances on the
website, if that's important to you, but as Lance says, you may switch later if
you feel you made the wrong choice. The most important part for now is to pick
the one that you feel you will roleplay best.[0m
Cheri-Pye the large light violet felo hums melodically to itself as it wanders
in from the south.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
Purr the humanoid service robot, a Tardick lizard named Asteria, a small hot tea
dispenser, and Cheri-Pye the large light violet felo here.

   Ammunition: Unlimited         Time To Fire: 8 seconds

ABILITIES
--
ARC
   Damages a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PLASMA HAMMER
   Damages a single target with heavy, slow burst damage.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
WAVE
   Damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
ERODE
   Covers a group of enemies with corroding plasma, reducing their armor.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
ENVELOP
   Surrounds a target with plasma.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
CASCADE
   Damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     70                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SPIKE
   A swift attack against a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 3 seconds
BOLT
   Heavily damages a single target.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
BURST
   Heavily damages a group of targets.
   Module:     Plasma
   Energy:     100               Time To Use: 6 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.

ABILITIES
--
MINOR REPAIR
   Slightly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REGENERATE
   Repairs a single target over time. A slow but efficient repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MINOR GROUP REPAIR
   Slightly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 6 seconds
PREEMPTIVE REPAIR
   Disperses some minidrones for preventative repairs, which will assist other
friendly minidrones in their work.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MODERATE REPAIR
   Repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SQUAD RESTORATION
   Grants the squad very slow generative repair.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 4 seconds
MODERATE GROUP REPAIR
   Repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     60                Time To Use: 8 seconds
MAJOR REPAIR
   Greatly repairs a single target.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     40                Time To Use: 12 seconds
MAJOR GROUP REPAIR
   Greatly repairs your entire squad.
   Module:     Minidrone
   Energy:     80                Time To Use: 12 seconds
PULSE
   Stuns a single target.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SCRAMBLE
   Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 6 seconds
REVERB
   Damages a single target over time.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 6 seconds
SONIC SLAM
   Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 8 seconds
SONIC WAVE
   Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     25                Time To Use: 10 seconds
SHAKE OFF
   Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     20                Time To Use: 4 seconds
GROUP PULSE
   Stuns a group of targets.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     30                Time To Use: 8 seconds
CONFUSE
   Decreases the reaction time of a group of enemies.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 6 seconds
KNOCKOUT
   Makes a single target unresponsive indefinitely, or until it is hit.
   Module:     Sonics
   Energy:     50                Time To Use: 12 seconds

l
[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room] (inside a battlesuit)
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a discount beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, and a greater minimodule of projectile boost here.
You can go up and out.
[Tactical Communication] Jacob Smitt transmits, "I unfortunetly only have access
to Tier's 2 in any suit, Sir."

front. You carefully climb out.

drive tracer, a greater minimodule of projectile boost, and an EAOS Conjurer
here.

[Tactical Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "No EAOS battlesuits for either
of you?"
[Tactical Communication] Pilot Kerry Rodriguez transmits, "No, but I could
switch."
[Tactical Communication] Jacob Smitt transmits, "I can grab one, easily enough.
It would take me 60 seconds to swap."
[Tactical Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "Please do! EAOS battlesuits,
highest tier you can get, all the plasma abilities you can get. Please also make
sure you get lasers instead of armor."
[Tactical Communication] Ather Jammoa transmits, "Meet at the New Earth lounge."

holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer. You are concealing a black flightbag with a red shooting star on
the side, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a leather briefcase, a
flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a thick synthleather
bandolier with large pockets, a camera bag, and a black engineering tool case.

both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
