commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
f......................................................Heavy Zapper
f2.....................................................Heavy Laser Cutter
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
pu.....................................................Pulse              
(Stuns a single target.)
ar.....................................................Arc                
(Damages a single target.)
scr....................................................Scramble           
(Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.)
ph.....................................................Plasma Hammer      
(Damages a single target with heavy, slow burst damage.)
wv.....................................................Wave               
(Damages a group of targets.)
er.....................................................Erode              
(Covers a group of enemies with corroding plasma, reducing their armor.)
env....................................................Envelop            
(Surrounds a target with plasma.)
cs.....................................................Cascade            
(Damages a group of targets.)
sp.....................................................Spike               (A
swift attack against a single target.)
rv.....................................................Reverb             
(Damages a single target over time.)
ss.....................................................Sonic Slam         
(Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.)
swv....................................................Sonic Wave         
(Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.)
shk....................................................Shake Off          
(Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.)
gp.....................................................Group Pulse        
(Stuns a group of targets.)
bo.....................................................Bolt               
(Heavily damages a single target.)
bur....................................................Burst              
(Heavily damages a group of targets.)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover

Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
f......................................................Heavy Zapper
f2.....................................................Heavy Laser Cutter
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
pu.....................................................Pulse              
(Stuns a single target.)
ar.....................................................Arc                
(Damages a single target.)
scr....................................................Scramble           
(Increases the likelihood that an enemy will drop intact items.)
ph.....................................................Plasma Hammer      
(Damages a single target with heavy, slow burst damage.)
wv.....................................................Wave               
(Damages a group of targets.)
er.....................................................Erode              
(Covers a group of enemies with corroding plasma, reducing their armor.)
env....................................................Envelop            
(Surrounds a target with plasma.)
cs.....................................................Cascade            
(Damages a group of targets.)
sp.....................................................Spike               (A
swift attack against a single target.)
rv.....................................................Reverb             
(Damages a single target over time.)
ss.....................................................Sonic Slam         
(Interrupts a group of enemies with a large sonic burst.)
swv....................................................Sonic Wave         
(Decreases the accuracy of a group of enemies.)
shk....................................................Shake Off          
(Makes an enemy slightly more disinclined to hit you.)
gp.....................................................Group Pulse        
(Stuns a group of targets.)
bo.....................................................Bolt               
(Heavily damages a single target.)
bur....................................................Burst              
(Heavily damages a group of targets.)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[Ventilation Tunnels; Entry Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This appears to be an access point to a space station's large ventilation
system. Though, saying that, it doesn't appear quite large enough for a
battlesuit, and the presence of the heavy powered armor appears to be distending
the metal somewhat. But anything is better than a ventilation system filled with
giant bugs and mold!
You can go west.

burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Lily Kaise (AEU Combat Universalist).

burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Ather Jammoa (League Paladin).

peer w
You peer west...
[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You can go north and east.
Ather Jammoa moves west.

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to AFW Command (Dock One) in thirty seconds unless aborted or another
navigation order is entered."

"Hello, William Dove. Welcome to Accord space."

Four).

Lily Kaise
She appears to be 28 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
abdomen is attractive and punctuated by a cute navel. Her face is oval and
pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush
pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of
arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her waist-length,
straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls
down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.

lavender lace demi bra, a pair of skinny blue low rise jeans, and a pair of
lavender leather boots. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer
bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells
around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring

abdomen, both wrists, both hands, and waist are left uncovered.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a dusky pink rattan cabinet, a small red ball containing a realistic
Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy pale purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a large oval
dark purple and light purple cloth rug, a white four poster rattan bed with a
heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle
cashmere blanket, a set of lavender silk sheets, a large periwinkle bed pillow,
a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt, and a large periwinkle bed pillow
on it, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, a pair of white
cotton briefs, and Cheri-Pye the large light violet felo here.
Lily Kaise is sleeping on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.

and filmy deep purple hangings with a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a set of

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
out
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, an
early warning space defense device, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo chow bowl,
and KitCat the humanoid service robot here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.

ftl b-60
Your ship 'Critical Strike' has been automatically moved into a garage.
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.
Via general sector communication, Beacon B-60 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Firestorm.' Welcome to Sector B-60."

[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.

launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You begin the launch sequence.

power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
i
 You are wearing a soft red heather cotton polo, a pair of slim blue stone linen
trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you
are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of white socks. You are
also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black
leather phone holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold
wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing a black flightbag with a red
shooting star on the side, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a
leather briefcase, a flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping
xenology container, a scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse,
a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a camera bag, and a black
engineering tool case. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both
forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying nothing.
l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
d
You can't go that way.
out
[Starship "Firestorm"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
out
You exit the ship.

lifter, a space lifter, a space lifter, a space lifter, and a space lifter here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
enter dove

aboard an automated flatbed, then lowered to the floor.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]

black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,

focus on one or the other.

[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
[0m#SESSION 'StarConquest' ACTIVATED.[0m
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit
aquarium containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white
trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container,
and Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
i
 You are wearing a soft red heather cotton polo, a pair of slim blue stone linen
trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. Underneath this, you
are wearing a pair of white cotton briefs and a pair of white socks. You are
also wearing a keychain, a backpack, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black
leather phone holster, a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, and a gold
wrist-mounted chronometer. You are concealing a black flightbag with a red
shooting star on the side, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a
leather briefcase, a flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping
xenology container, a scorched metal thigh holster, a golden Feng Wo coin purse,
a thick synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a camera bag, and a black
engineering tool case. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both
forearms, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
You are carrying Cheri-Pye the sleeping large light violet felo in your right
hand.

ftl old earth

ftl old earth
Your ship 'William Dove' has been automatically moved into a garage.
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Old Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

l
[Starship "Cassowary Rising"; Weapons Room Four]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see a swiveling gray leather gunner's chair here.
You can go down.
sit chair
You sit down on a swiveling gray leather gunner's chair.
peer d
You peer down...
[Starship "Cassowary Rising"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is in space.
You see a swiveling gray leather gunner's chair and Lillian Hudson's workbench
here.
Lillian Hudson is sitting on a swiveling gray leather gunner's chair.
You can go north, south, up, and down.
The starship transitions into another sector.

[The Torus; Dock Alpha]
The pale gray walls, floor, and ceiling of this massive EAOS docking bay glow
with a pale white light. Though the bay remains open to space, it somehow also
retains its atmosphere. Outside, you can see the bright glint of a solitary
blue-white star. Signs indicate that the repair and rearm facility, the starship
supply store, and the main concourse are to the north.
The six-person pincer "Cassowary Rising" is landed here.

commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
la.....................................................Dual Gravitic Projector
gl.....................................................Gravitic Lance
pb.....................................................Proximity Bomb
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment

[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a discount beacon launcher, a wormhole
drive tracer, a greater minimodule of projectile boost, and a Fringe Hunter
here.

launch

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Fearless, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never

Starship Damage:
HULL: 16%.

repair hul
Syntax:
  REPAIR <component>
  Such as: repair hull
  Or:      repair launcher 2
  Or:      repair stop
Valid components are: hull, sensors, FTL, launcher, turret, or STOP
repair hull
You input a series of commands on the damage control computer, entering repair
orders for the hull.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
The damage control computer reports, "Beginning repair of the hull."

deploy
You press a prominent button, and a crane promptly retrieves a Fringe Hunter
from storage and sets it in front of you.
An assembly of robotic arms descends from the ceilings, rapidly reloading the
battlesuit's weapons.
enter
You press a button on a Fringe Hunter, which splits open down the front. You
carefully climb inside.
launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see Sentry Horde Replicator and Enhanced Warrior Alpha and Battle Auxiliary
Tactician Beta here.

Katina Faye (League Frontline Soldier).

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see the wreckage of Sentry Horde Replicator and Enhanced Warrior Alpha, the
wreckage of Battle Auxiliary Tactician Beta, Lillian Hudson (League Knight),
Melinda Michaels (AEU Utility Combatant), Katina Faye (League Frontline
Soldier), a chunk of a RATS nest defender, and a small pile of half-synthesized
metals here.

This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Alpha and Miniaturized
Interfacing Companion Entity Beta here.
You can go northeast and southwest.
Melinda Michaels picks up a space-grade detonator.
Lillian Hudson says, "More mices."
Lillian Hudson grins.

Lillian Hudson says, "Sure."
Lillian Hudson says, "Just alternate."
Katina Faye nods.

yellow eyes slowly, utterly indifferent to its surroundings.

This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[Starship "Shadowwind"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair here.
Lillian Hudson, Melinda Michaels, and Katina Faye are standing here.
You can go south and out.
n

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to New Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Fearless!
Welcome to home space!"

wait.

launch

ftl old earth

ftl old earth
Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.
The computer announces, "Autolander beacon detected. The ship will automatically
proceed to Old Earth in thirty seconds unless aborted or another navigation
order is entered."

l elissa
Elissa Rosales
She appears to be 24 years old. She is about five feet and ten inches tall and
has tan skin. Her body is slender with slightly curved hips and shapely calves.
She has narrow shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her face is
heart-shaped and lovely, with a button nose and strong chin. Her lips are full
and applied with ruby red lipstick, and occasionally part to reveal a set of
white teeth. Beneath a set of plucked eyebrows, her eyes are blue and
almond-shaped, and enhanced with blue eyeshadow. Her mid-back length, wavy hair
is chestnut brown and swept smoothly back into twin fishtail braids. She has
long dark pink fingernails. She has a hissing tarantula in her hair.
A sparkly gold ring with a sapphire cobra suspended from it pierces her right
earlobe and a sparkly gold ring with a sapphire cobra suspended from it pierces
her left earlobe.
 She is wearing a tight crimson tank top with a gold 'XX' embroidered across the
front, a pair of dark blue stonewashed denim jeans with a small dark red 'XX'
embroidered on the left front pocket, and a pair of knee-high blood red leather
boots with stiletto heels and long fringe around the top. She is also wearing a
keychain, a message board reader, a portable newsfeed aggregator, a red
metachannel FTL communicator, a small cloth sack, a smooth black velvet handbag,
a blood red backpack, a dark blue flightbag, a bulky asteroid supply cannon, and
a dark metallic red touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster. Her head,
face, both eyes, neck, both shoulders, both biceps, both elbows, both forearms,
both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying a Fudge Fusion Bar in her right hand, and a warm lemon-poppy
seed muffin in her left hand.
Elissa Rosales tears the end off a wrapper of a Fudge Fusion Bar.
Michael Kennedy takes a sip of a pint of strong black Chetumalian stout.
Elissa Rosales bites off the end of a Fudge Fusion Bar and chews slowly.
Elissa Rosales says, "That's really good."
Elissa Rosales takes a larger bite of a Fudge Fusion Bar. A bit of dark creamy
fudge appears at the corner of her mouth.
Rogue Romano grins.
Jacob Smitt chuckles.
Melinda Michaels says, "If you like candy."
Hakeem says to Elissa, "Like it more than the rest."
Elissa Rosales grins.
Elissa Rosales chews thoughtfully at the chocolate and fudge concoction in her

[Starship "Orcinus Orca"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport.
You see a decoy beacon launcher here.
Katina Faye is standing here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "Orcinus Orca"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is at Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport.

[Space Explorers Amidst The Stars] Shule Elemmire transmits, "Hi love. We just
left to go do salvage ops."
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
The swirling mist parts to reveal a gaping mouth! Before you can react, the ship
has plunged into it and into a fleshy pink tunnel.

[Starship "Orcinus Orca"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is inside the riftflow.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and south.
You begin familiarizing yourself with the engineering stations and making
various changes to your liking.

[Starship "Orcinus Orca"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.

occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
